trans-unit.source: Differences between the embedded client and the network client driver

seg-source.mrk: Differences between the embedded client and the network client driver

target.mrk: Differences between the embedded client and the network client driver

trans-unit.source: The following are known differences that exist between the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver and the network client driver.

seg-source.mrk: The following are known differences that exist between the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver and the network client driver.

target.mrk: The following are known differences that exist between the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver and the network client driver.

trans-unit.source: There may be undocumented differences that have not yet been identified. Some differences with the network client may be changed in future releases to match the embedded driver functionality.

seg-source.mrk: There may be undocumented differences that have not yet been identified.
Some differences with the network client may be changed in future releases to match the embedded driver functionality.

target.mrk: There may be undocumented differences that have not yet been identified.
Some differences with the network client may be changed in future releases to match the embedded driver functionality.

trans-unit.source: Error messages and <codeph>SQLState</codeph>s can differ between the network client and embedded driver.

seg-source.mrk: Error messages and <codeph>SQLState</codeph>s can differ between the network client and embedded driver.

target.mrk: Error messages and <codeph>SQLState</codeph>s can differ between the network client and embedded driver.

trans-unit.source: Treatment of error situations encountered during batch processing with <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph>, <codeph>java.sql.PreparedStatement</codeph>, and <codeph>java.sql.CallableStatement</codeph> is different. With the embedded driver, processing stops when an error is encountered; with the network client driver, processing continues, but an appropriate value as defined in the <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph> API is returned in the resulting update count array.

seg-source.mrk: Treatment of error situations encountered during batch processing with <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph>, <codeph>java.sql.PreparedStatement</codeph>, and <codeph>java.sql.CallableStatement</codeph> is different.

With the embedded driver, processing stops when an error is encountered; with the network client driver, processing continues, but an appropriate value as defined in the <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph> API is returned in the resulting update count array.

target.mrk: Treatment of error situations encountered during batch processing with <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph>, <codeph>java.sql.PreparedStatement</codeph>, and <codeph>java.sql.CallableStatement</codeph> is different.

With the embedded driver, processing stops when an error is encountered; with the network client driver, processing continues, but an appropriate value as defined in the <codeph>java.sql.Statement</codeph> API is returned in the resulting update count array.

trans-unit.source: To use an encrypted user id and password, you need to have the IBM's Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) Version 1.2.1 or later.

seg-source.mrk: To use an encrypted user id and password, you need to have the IBM's Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) Version 1.2.1 or later.

target.mrk: To use an encrypted user id and password, you need to have the IBM's Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) Version 1.2.1 or later.
